abstract: Governments facing opposition in sub-Saharan Africa call internet blackouts a security measure, but crippled communications are taking a toll on their economies.

abstract: The shutdown of the offices of Al Nadeem Center for Rehabilitation of Victims of Violence is the latest escalation in a campaign against human rights and civil liberties groups.
byline: By DECLAN WALSH and NOUR YOUSSEF
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

multimedia.caption: Magda Adly, right, of Al Nadeem Center for Rehabilitation of Victims of Violence at a news conference in Cairo last year. “I don’t understand how a regime with an army and a police force can be scared of 20 activists,” Ms. Adly said in a phone interview after the Egyptian government shut down the group’s offices.

Magda Adly, right, of Al Nadeem Center for Rehabilitation of Victims of Violence at a news conference in Cairo last year. “I don’t understand how a regime with an army and a police force can be scared of 20 activists,” Ms. Adly said in a phone interview after the Egyptian government shut down the group’s offices.

abstract: President Trump and Mr. Xi, the Chinese leader, spoke by phone on Thursday evening after an extended chill in the two countries’ relationship.
byline: By MARK LANDLER and MICHAEL FORSYTHE

multimedia.caption: President Xi Jinping of China in Lima, Peru, last year. The fact that President Trump and Mr. Xi had not talked since Mr. Trump took office in January had drawn increasing scrutiny.
